intro: Webera adunca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved webera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Webera adunca is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
